str2: From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To pervert, corrupt, oppose, distort. From dia and strepho; to distort, i.e. misinterpret, or corrupt.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
From apo and spao; to drag forth, i.e. unsheathe, or relatively retire.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Behind, after; back, backwards. From the same as opisthen with enclitic of direction; to the back, i.e. Aback.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
